intro: Galium martirense, commonly known as the Martirense bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pale pink flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium martirense thrives in rocky, coastal environments and is adapted to the unique microclimates of its native habitat. It is a relatively rare species, contributing to the botanical diversity of the Canary Islands.
